original: Tom knew that he wouldn't be able to finish the report by 2:30.
translated: Tom savait qu’il serait incapable de finir le rapport avant 14 h 30.

original: Better to be the head of a dog than the tail of a lion.
translated: Il vaut mieux être la tête d'un chien que la queue d'un lion.

original: The bamboo is bending with the weight of the snow.
translated: Le bambou plie sous le poids de la neige.

original: She spoke highly of you.
translated: Elle a été dithyrambique à votre sujet.

original: Is Miss Dupont absent today?
translated: Est-ce que mademoiselle Dupont est absente aujourd'hui ?

original: You came on Monday, leaving again the following day.
translated: Tu es venue le lundi et es repartie le jour suivant.

original: You should savour this moment.
translated: Tu devrais savourer cet instant.

original: Are you mentally ill?
translated: Êtes-vous une malade mentale ?

original: They won't risk doing that.
translated: Ils ne risqueront pas de faire cela.

original: We can't change history, but we can learn from it.
translated: Nous ne pouvons changer l'histoire, mais nous pouvons apprendre d'elle.

original: His aunt takes care of his dog during the day.
translated: Sa tante s'occupe de son chien pendant la journée.

original: She is proud of her students.
translated: Elle est fière de ses élèves.

original: All visitors are welcome.
translated: Tous les visiteurs sont les bienvenus.

original: How long will you be here?
translated: Combien de temps serez-vous ici ?

original: Give me your sword.
translated: Donne-moi ton épée.

original: There is no reason to be sorry.
translated: Il n'y a aucune raison d'être désolé.

original: My boyfriend looks like your girlfriend.
translated: Mon copain ressemble à ta copine.

original: I have entered on an enterprise which is without precedent, and will have no imitator.
translated: Je forme une entreprise qui n'eut jamais d'exemple et dont l'exécution n'aura point d'imitateur.

original: Busy, as usual?
translated: Occupé, comme d'habitude ?

original: We plan to stay a week.
translated: Nous envisageons de rester une semaine.

original: He chopped down the branch with an ax.
translated: Il a coupé la branche avec une hache.

original: It was a divine intervention.
translated: Ça a été une intervention divine.

original: I only ever wanted what was best for you.
translated: J'ai toujours voulu ce qu'il y avait de mieux pour toi.

original: You've got to be hardy!
translated: Tu dois être hardie !

original: They're not all busy.
translated: Ils ne sont pas tous occupés.

original: I am hating this weather!
translated: Je déteste ce temps !

original: I know they'll all want to help you.
translated: Je sais qu'ils voudront tous vous assister.

original: Tom sang better than Mary did.
translated: Tom a mieux chanté que Marie.

original: Don't blame him for the error.
translated: Ne lui reprochez pas cette erreur.

original: You're dangerous.
translated: Tu es dangereuse.

original: Singing is her thing.
translated: Chanter est son dada.

original: Do you believe that you are alone in the world?
translated: Croyez-vous que vous êtes seul au monde ?

original: I don't see him much.
translated: Je ne le vois pas souvent.

original: Those who practice medicine provide health care.
translated: Ceux qui pratiquent la médecine fournissent des soins de santé.

original: Were you spying on me?
translated: M'espionnais-tu ?

original: That's better, isn't it?
translated: C'est mieux, n'est-ce pas ?

original: You've been suspended.
translated: Vous avez été suspendus.

original: The wild boars devoured the acorns.
translated: Les sangliers ont dévoré les glands.

original: He's very good at maths.
translated: Il est très fort en maths.

original: Everyone's relieved.
translated: Tout le monde est soulagé.

original: My cat is hungry.
translated: Mon chat a faim.

original: She didn't want to think about it.
translated: Elle ne voulait pas y penser.

original: Don't you push me, boy!
translated: Ne me pousse pas, mon garçon !

original: He heard footsteps.
translated: Il entendit des pas.
